item.title: Graduate Level Instruction
item.description:
Graduate Level Instruction (2017 - Present)

Total Teaching Hours: 150+ contact hours

Current Institutions

EPITA (2023 - Present)

  • Machine Learning Foundations: Core principles of ML, optimization, and statistical learning
  • Reinforcement Learning: Advanced RL algorithms, policy optimization, and multi-agent systems
  • Natural Language Processing: Modern NLP techniques, transformers, and language models
  • Large Language Models: Architecture, training, fine-tuning, and applications of LLMs

CentraleSupélec

  • Advanced Machine Learning: Graduate-level course covering state-of-the-art ML techniques
  • Focus on theoretical foundations and practical applications in real-world scenarios

Université Technologique de Compiègne

  • Deep Learning Applications: Hands-on course in deep learning with focus on computer vision and NLP
  • Practical labs using PyTorch and modern deep learning frameworks

Université Grenoble Alpes

  • Research Methods in AI: Graduate seminar on conducting AI research
  • Supervision of research projects and thesis work

Teaching Philosophy

My teaching approach emphasizes:

  • Theory-Practice Balance: Combining rigorous theoretical foundations with hands-on implementation
  • Current Research Integration: Incorporating latest research developments into coursework
  • Industry Relevance: Connecting academic concepts to real-world applications
  • Interactive Learning: Encouraging student participation and collaborative problem-solving

Course Development

  • Developed new curriculum for emerging AI technologies including LLMs and robotic learning
  • Created practical labs and programming assignments using modern frameworks (PyTorch, JAX, Hugging Face)
  • Integrated industry case studies and real-world problem-solving scenarios
  • Designed capstone projects connecting students with ongoing research initiatives

Student Supervision

  • PhD Students: Active supervision of doctoral candidates in machine learning and robotics
  • Master’s Projects: 15+ undergraduate and graduate project supervisions
  • Research Collaborations: Coordinating student involvement in industry research partnerships
